problem_text: \overrightarrow Q P and \overrightarrow Q R are opposite rays, and \overrightarrow Q T bisects \angle S Q R. If m \angle S Q R = 6 x + 8 and m \angle T Q R = 4 x - 14, find m \angle S Q T.
compact_text: \overrightarrow QP and \overrightarrow QR are opposite rays, and \overrightarrow QT bisects \angle SQR. If m \angle SQR = 6x+8 and m \angle TQR = 4x-14, find m \angle SQT.
annotat_text: $\overrightarrow{QP}$ and $\overrightarrow{QR}$ are opposite rays, and $\overrightarrow{QT}$ bisects $\angle SOR$. If $m \angle SOR=6x+8$ and $m \angle TOR=4x-14,$ find $m \angle SQT$.
